algorithm_technique: Use a hash set to store unique elements and check if max - min + 1 equals length and unique count.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an array contains all numbers in a consecutive sequence starting from its minimum value.
problem_summary_technical: An array is consecutive if its range (max - min + 1) equals its length and all elements are unique.
key_insights: The condition `max(nums) - min(nums) + 1 == len(nums)` checks if the span of numbers matches the count.
The `len(set(nums)) == len(nums)` part ensures there are no duplicates.
This approach is efficient as it involves finding min/max and creating a set, all typically O(n).
It correctly identifies arrays like [1, 3, 2] as consecutive.
